name: vscode-ltex
description: LanguageTool grammar checking with LaTeX support
author: Julian Valentin

ltex.enabled.markdownDescription: Controls whether the extension is enabled. Allows to disable LanguageTool on specific workspaces.

ltex.language.markdownDescription: The language (e.g., `en-US`) LanguageTool should check against. For supported languages see the [list of languages at LanguageTool.org](https://languagetool.org/languages/). Requires the installation of a [language support extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/search?term=ltex&target=VSCode). See the Marketplace description of the installed *language support extension* for possible values. Use a specific variant like `en-US` or `de-DE` instead of the generic language code like `en` or `de` to obtain spelling corrections (in addition to grammar corrections).

enumDescriptions: Error diagnostics are usually underlined with a red squiggly line and appear in editor, minimap, Problems tab, and Explorer.
Warning diagnostics are usually underlined with a yellow squiggly line and appear in editor, minimap, Problems tab, and Explorer.
Information diagnostics are usually underlined with a blue squiggly line and appear in editor, minimap, and Problems tab, but not in the Explorer.
Hint diagnostics are not underlined (only subtly marked) and only appear in the editor, not in minimap, Problems tab, or Explorer.
ltex.diagnosticSeverity.markdownDescription: Severity of the diagnostics corresponding to the grammar and spelling errors. Allows to control how and where the diagnostics appear in Visual Studio Code.

ltex.commands.ignore.markdownDescription: List of additional L<sup>A</sup>T<sub>E</sub>X commands to be ignored by the L<sup>A</sup>T<sub>E</sub>X parser, listed together with empty arguments.

ltex.commands.dummy.markdownDescription: List of additional L<sup>A</sup>T<sub>E</sub>X commands to be replaced by dummy words (i.e., Dummy0, Dummy1, etc.), listed together with empty arguments. LT<sub>E</sub>X internally uses this mechanism for equations, citations, references, and similar constructs that are part of the sentence structure and for which LanguageTool would throw an error if simply omitted from the checked text.

rule.markdownDescription: The identifier of the LanguageTool rule.

sentence.markdownDescription: The sentence after parsing as supplied to LanguageTool.

ltex.ignoreRuleInSentence.markdownDescription: Individual rule/sentence pairs to ignore, i.e., no diagnostics of the specified rule will be displayed for the specified sentence. Add sentences by using the `Ignore in this sentence` quick fix.

enumDescriptions: When adding a word to the dictionary, always update the global configuration.
When adding a word to the dictionary, update the workspace configuration if currently in a workspace, otherwise the global configuration.
When ignoring a rule in a sentence, always update the global configuration.
When ignoring a rule in a sentence, update the workspace configuration if currently in a workspace, otherwise the global configuration.

ltex.configurationTarget.markdownDescription: Controls which `settings.json` to update when using one of the quick fixes.

ltex.additionalRules.languageModel.markdownDescription: Path to a directory with rules of a language model with *n*-gram occurrence counts.

ltex.additionalRules.neuralNetworkModel.markdownDescription: Path to a directory with rules of a pretrained neural network model.

ltex.additionalRules.word2VecModel.markdownDescription: Path to a directory with rules of a word2vec language model.
